title: Rancho Mirage Affordable Housing and Disney Cotino project

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rancho Mirage Affordable Housing and Disney Cotino project
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the following documents:
1. City Council and Housing Authority meeting minutes, agendas, and supporting documents concerning the Disney Cotino project
2. All Requests for Proposals ("RFP"), Requests for Bids ("RFB"), Requests for Qualifications ("RFQ"), for any development of housing in the City
3. All documents reflecting discussions any City employee or agent has had with the developer of the Disney Cotino project, concerning set asides for 55+ housing, or concerning set asides for affordable housing
4. All responses, and statement of qualifications in response to any RFP, RFB, or RFQ for affordable housing, including the City's August 28, 2023 RFQ for Multi-Family Affordable Housing Development.
5. All communications with any housing consultant to develop an RFP, RFB, or RFQ on affordable housing
6. All agreements between the City and any developer of the Disney Cotinio project, including any Exclusive Negotiation Agreements, or Disposition and Development Agreements. 
7. All agreements between the City and any consultant who advised the City on any multifamily housing RFP, RFB, or RFQ.
8. City Council and Housing Authority meeting minutes, agendas, and supporting documents concerning the development of affordable housing from January 2023 to the present.
9. Any disclosures of conflict of interest submitted by any consultant, developer, or applicant to develop, affordable housing.
10. Any disclosures of conflict of interest submitted by any consultant, developer, or applicant to develop, the Disney Cotino project.
11. Any City Council and Housing Authority meeting minutes, agendas, and supporting documents concerning the alteration of density zoning to accommodate affordable housing.
12. Any City Council and Housing Authority meeting minutes, agendas, and supporting documents concerning the alteration of density zoning to accommodate the Disney Cotino project.
13. All questions and comments submitted in response to the City's August 28, 2023 RFQ for Multi-Family Affordable Housing Development.
14. All communications from January 1, 2023 to the present, between any City employee (including but not limited to Marcus Aleman and Majna Dukic) on the one hand, and any nonprofit affordable housing developer on the other hand.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Annette Morasch

title: 2023: Board President Emails, RYH

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: 2023: Board President Emails, RYH
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

On August 7, 2023, President Shi used jianan@ilraiseyourhand.org to conduct business. Please see highlighted attachment provided via FOIA N014197-091223. 

Please provide records sufficient to show the following:

1. A log of all emails to/from Jianan Shi at jianan@ilraiseyourhand.org, currently CPS Board Member, from August 1, 2023 through August 31, 2023. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), cc line, bcc line, date and time, subject line, and attachment.

As the statute allows a requester to request a specific file format, please provide the records in an excel format. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

title: Email messages to ITD_PDR@seattle.gov about public records

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Email messages to ITD_PDR@seattle.gov about public records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

E-mail messages received by City of Seattle, addressed to ITD_PDR@seattle.gov, whether that address was listed as a recipient (e.g., in the TO: or CC: header fields) or not (e.g., if a message was BCC'd to this address, thus resulting in the address' use on the message envelope but not in its headers), between November 10, 2020, and now, whose subjects contain the text "record" or " records".

ITD_PDR@seattle.gov is the address which Seattle's Department of Information Technology published as the point of contact for the IT Department for matters regarding Public Disclosure Requests (ITD_PDR).

Please send these messages in their native electronic format--please do not render them to PDF or provide images of computer screens depicting visual renderings of the messages.

If you elect to send these in batches, please provide them in chronological order.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Phil Mocek

title: EPA Engagement UN Global Plastics Treaty Negotiations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: EPA Engagement UN Global Plastics Treaty Negotiations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

TIME Magazine is looking for e-mails, memos, meeting notes, briefing agendas and other documents related to the United Nation’s Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee on Plastic Pollution (INC 1-5), United Nations Environment Assembly (UNEA5) and international plastic production treaties from Jan. 20, 2022 to the present.

TIME seeks correspondence between EPA officials (Stephanie Adrian, Karissa Kovner, Laura Nazef, Elizabeth Shaw et. al) and representatives of:
- American Chemistry Council and/or Ed Brzytwa, Josh Baca
- The World Plastics Council
- The Plastics Industry Association
- American Fuel and Petrochemical Manufacturers
- Alliance to End Plastic Waste and/ or Jacob Duer
- Dow Chemical
 -Garcia Government Affairs
- Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
- SABIC
- BASF
- DuPont Chemical
- ExxonMobile 

As global negotiations continue for a United Nations plastics treaty, the role of the Environmental Protection Agency, and in any potential lobbying interests on behalf of industry in informing US policy over a globally recognized pollutant is of great of public interest. For this reason, and the fact that I am working for a national news outlet (TIME Magazine), I would like to request a fee waiver. If any of the above requested information is refused, please do provide an explanation of what cannot be shared, and why.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aryn Baker, Senior Correspondent TIME Magazine

title: OIG Case Management System (CMS)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OIG Case Management System (CMS)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to a Privacy Impact Assessment (https://www2.ed.gov/notices/pia/oig-pia-cms.pdf), The U.S. Department of Education (ED) Office of Inspector General (OIG) Case Management System (CMS) is a web-based system that tracks complaints, preliminary inquiries, and investigations that OIG Staff use for case management and program referral capabilities. The system is designed to facilitate criminal, civil, and administrative investigations of fraud, waste, and abuse in programs administered by the Department of Education. The CMS is designed to generate statutorily required information and management reports, as well as assisting in the overall management and collection of data that is required for successful prosecutions. Data output is typically PDF, Microsoft Excel, or text formats. 

I am looking for:
1. A log of all complaints, preliminary inquiries, and investigations tracked by the CMS since 01/01/2018.  Please include all columns of the database.
2.  The current database schema, data dictionary, or other reference document(s) to how ED OIG keeps track of invoices.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Early COVID communications

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Early COVID communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Between the very beginning of March 1st, 2020, to the very end of March 5th, 2020:

The following, that are explicitly listed as available in the executive chamber data dictionary:
briefings, research, analyses, resource material, opinions, recommendations, reports, and correspondence, State Operations Directives, Governor’s Correspondence, Lieutenant Governor’s Correspondence.

As well as the following, should they be available, emails and other communications that are searchable but not otherwise included above.

This records search shall only include records pertaining to, created by, or mentioning, the following employees:
Melissa deRosa
Beth Garvey
Kelly Cummings
Abigail Barker
Dana Carotenuto
Stephanie Benton
Rich Azzopardi
Dani Lever
Jill DesRosiers
Peter Ajemian
Larry Schwartz
Thomas Feeney
Matthew Saal

As well as the following individuals who were identified in press conferences as special advisors or otherwise part of "the team", where records may exist from their interactions with the chamber and role as advisors:
Robert Mujica
Jim Malatras (SUNY)
Sherlita Amler, Westchester commissioner of public health
LAWRENCE E. EISENSTEIN, MD, MPH, FACP, Nassau county Commissioner of Health
Dr. Gregson H. Pigott, Suffolk county health Commissioner

Should that be too broad of a search, I request that you further narrow the search to only records pertaining to the then-beginning outbreak, which may have been referred to by many names, including:

"SARS", "SARS-COV-2", "SARS-nCOV-2019", "Coronavirus", "COVID", "COVID-19", "Wuhan Coronavirus", "Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome", "2019-nCoV", "the virus", also, terms I would never personally use to describe it, like "Wuhan flu", "Chinese virus", or similar.

And/or including the terms:
"Respirator", "airborne", "aerosol", "n95", "filter", "ventilation", "precautionary", and "HVAC".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ALEXANDER RICCIO

title: Terrorist Screening Center Audit Reports

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sirs:
This letter constitutes a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, on behalf of Targeted Justice Inc.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to Targeted Justice:
    1. All Office of Inspector General’s audit reports of the Terrorist Screening Center from the year 2007 to the present.
    2. Federal Bureau of Investigation and Terrorist Screening Center emails, letters, replies, objections other document filed or sent in reaction to the Office of Inspector General’s audit reports since 2007.
    3. Documents regarding administrative or judicial enforcement action to bring agency into compliance with regulations, the constitution and the law.
    4. Complaints made to the Office of Inspector General since 2007 regarding the Terrorist Screening Center Operations. 
        
The term “document” is to be liberally construed to include any file, paper, microfilm, digital archive, or any other format where the information sought may be stored.
As you know, FOIA requires agencies to release information unless it is specifically exempt from disclosure, and also requires agencies to release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of documents, i.e., to redact exempt portions of documents and release the rest. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(8).
Targeted Justice's status as a news organization that provides information of public interest to its members warrants the expedited processing of this Request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed by an organization primarily engaged in disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2); 28 C.F.R. § n16.5(d)(1)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).
Request for expedited processing
Targeted Justice currently has over 9,000 subscribers and over 115,000 thousands views a month in its Substack newsletter. Thus, pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466 it is a news media organization.
Targeted Justice also requests the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that the records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity” See 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2)(i); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii)(A); see also 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(d)(1)(iv); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

In light of the above, Targeted Justice requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.
Request for Fee Waiver
Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2).
Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as Targeted Justice will report the results of this endeavor on the grounds that Targeted Justice qualifies as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).
For any document you fail to produce, Targeted Justice requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.
If you need to discuss this request, the undersigned can be reached at 832-247-3046. Thank you for your consideration of my request.
Sincerely,

Ana L. Toledo, Esq.	
Targeted Justice, Inc.
P.O. Box 15990
Houston, TX  77220

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Targeted Justice

communications.subject: FOIA Request  24-00055-F
communications.communication:
October 6, 2023 RE: FOIA Request No.  24-00055-F: 
Dear Remy Noìchlaf: 
This letter is in response to your request for informationpursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, datedOctober 5, 2023 and received in this office on October 6, 2023. 
You requested the following: “Pursuant to the Freedom of InformationAct, I hereby request the following records: Transcript of all captioned media.” 
In order to process your request more effectively, we needclarification of the information that you requested.  The information needed is as follows: 
Please specify the records you are seeking, as well as adate range for the documents. Please also specify which office to search forrecords, you can find the Department's organization chart at https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/or/index.html. (https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/or/index.html) 
Please provide the clarification requested above within ten(10) business days from the date of this letter. Once we receive theinformation, we will assign your request to the appropriate office(s) to searchfor documents responsive to your request. If no response is received within thetime frame provided above, your request will be administratively closed. 
If you have any questions, please contact the FOIA ServiceCenter (FSC) at 202-401-8365 or EDFOIAManager@ed.gov. (mailto:EDFOIAManager@ed.gov) 
Sincerely, 
ED FOIA Manager 
GovernmentInformation Specialist 
Office of theSecretary

Sincerely,

Winter Calvert
